result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rose L Barfield

records.addlTxt: No contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol.  Contact with minor children as permitted by DHS is allowed.
No contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol.  Contact with minor children as permitted by DHS is allowed.

1:51 PM Defendant Rose L Barfield in court, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Rose L Barfield.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF71, 21CM335, 22CF231, 22CM32

Atty Rivard - deft is restricted from her residence on all bonds, asking to lift that restriction - PMM has now relocated, also asking for modification of bond to be allowed contact with JCE, LMM, DRB per DHS rules in cases 22CF71 & 22CF231, asks for modification of cash bond in 22CF71 to sign bond, asks for modification of cash bond in 22CF231 to sign bond

State - no objection to removal of no contact with residence, Court already allowed communication with children as allowed by CHIPS actions, objects to modification of cash component of bonds

Atty Rivard - makes argument
Court - speaks to deft
Deft - makes statement to the Court
Court - will modify bond if deft has inpatient setup, will not modify cash bond amounts, removes no contact with residence, allows contact with minor children as permitted by DHS
Motion to Modify Bond

no contact with MME 11/29/2000, or residence of *address confidential*, no contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no contact with JCE 11/06/2010 except through electronic means, LMM 3/19/2015 except through electronic means, DRB 9/29/2009 except through electronic means - Refused to sign

11:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rose L Barfield in court, in custody .  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Rose L Barfield. A. Standaert - Clerk 

Atty Rivard - rec'd copy of information, waives further reading, enters NG plea to each count
State - notes jury is scheduled for older case
Court - schedules return date

Atty Rivard - asks to be heard on bond
Court - reviews bond history
Atty Rivard - makes argument for bond modification to reinstate sign bond and to remove no contact with address as it's her address
State - makes argument, objects to modification of bond
Court - asks Atty Rivard to put bond modification in writing and include all cases, will not modify bond today
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rose L Barfield in court, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard not in court. A. Standaert - Clerk 

Court - left voicemail for Attorney Rivard
Deft - ok with rescheduling
Court - so schedules
Arraignment scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:10 am.
Arraignment on August 9, 2022 at 11:10 am.

3:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rose L Barfield in court, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Rose L Barfield. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - asks Court to take judicial notice of the sign bond in Dunn County case 22CF71
Atty Rivard - no objection
Court - take judicial notice of sign bond in Dunn County case 22CF71
State - calls Officer Abigail Wood who is sworn in and testifies
Officer Wood identifies deft
Atty Rivard - cross-examination of Officer Wood
Officer Wood is excused
State - makes argument for Court to find probable cause and bind deft over for trial
Atty Rivard - asks Court to strike all bond jumping charges
Court - took judicial notice of sign bond in Dunn County case 22CF71, finds probable cause and binds deft over for trial
Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Arraignment on August 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
to reschedule with Attorney Rivard

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rose L Barfield appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appeared by video for Rose L Barfield. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF231, 22CF71

State - asking for $500 cash bond - no contact with MME 11/29/2000, or residence of *address confidential*, PMM 12/13/1986, JCE 11/06/2010 except through electronic means, LMM 3/19/2015 except through electronic means, DRB 9/29/2009 except through electronic means

Atty Tomtschik - asking for sign bond, asks Court to not approve no contact with minors

Court - orders $500 cash bond - no contact with MME 11/29/2000, or residence of *address confidential*, no contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no contact with JCE 11/06/2010 except through electronic means, LMM 3/19/2015 except through electronic means, DRB 9/29/2009 except through electronic means

INIT 22CF231
Atty Tomtschik - waives reading and asks for speedy prelim

Bond modification for 22CF71
State - asks to reinstate bond to $2500 cash bond (currently sign bond)
Atty Tomtschik - deft does not have the ability to post cash, asks bond to remain the same
Court - orders $2500 cash bond
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
